snippet: A 27-year-old man’s death, while he was working on a community peace project, happened in a city enjoying a gentrification boom but still bogged down by crime.
abstract: Killing of Antonio Ramos, who was gunned down while painting community peace mural in Oakland, Calif, points to lingering violence and tensions amid city's rapid gentrification; murder rate appears to be increasing as Oakland courts technology industry; residents note difficulty of reconciling newcomers' ways with native culture.
lead_paragraph: A 27-year-old man’s death, while he was working on a community peace project, happened in a city enjoying a gentrification boom but still bogged down by crime.

headline.main: Mural Painter’s Killing Reminds Oakland That Revival Can Be Slow
headline.print_headline: Killing of Muralist Is Stark Reminder of Obstacles Left in Oakland Revival
